dt: {bc}a crust of hardened blood and serum over a wound
{bc}a worker who refuses to join a labor union
{bc}a union member who refuses to strike or returns to work before a strike has ended
{bc}a worker who accepts employment or replaces a union worker during a strike
{bc}one who works for less than union wages or on nonunion terms
{bc}any of various bacterial or fungus diseases of plants characterized by crustaceous spots

et: Middle English, of Scandinavian origin; akin to Old Swedish {it}skabbr{/it} scab; akin to Old English {it}sceabb{/it} scab, Latin {it}scabere{/it} to scratch {ma}{mat|shave|}{/ma}
shortdef: a crust of hardened blood and serum over a wound
to become covered with a scab

dt: {bc}a disease of apple trees caused by a fungus ({it}Venturia inaequalis{/it}) producing dark blotches or lesions on the leaves, fruit, and sometimes the young twigs

shortdef: a disease of apple trees caused by a fungus (Venturia inaequalis) producing dark blotches or lesions on the leaves, fruit, and sometimes the young twigs
